  • Find issues with TMFA

Find issues with TMFAÂ¶

findIssuesWithTMFA(ensemble, DGr_std_min, DGr_std_max, vmin, vmax, xmin, xmax, ineqConstraints, K, RT, delta, M, tol, gurobiModel, options, params)Â¶

Finds out why the TMFA problem is infeasible.

This is done by first trying to find which reactionsâ standard Gibbs energies or metabolite concentrations are causing the problem to be infeasible. If no reactions nor metabolites are deemed to be the cause and if the LP solver is set to gurobi, the MILP is written into a text file and the function gurobi_iis is used to find which constraints/variable bounds are causing the issue.

Problematic metabolites and/or reactions can be missed due to a large K value, especially when using intlinprog (same issue as in computeGibbsFreeEnergyRanges). Thus the loop for decreasing K values when the lists of problematic reactions and metabolites are empty.

Usage

findIssuesWithTMFA(ensemble,DGr_std_min,DGr_std_max,vmin,vmax,xmin,xmax,ineqConstraints,K,RT,delta,M,tol,gurobiModel,options,params)

Inputs

  • ensemble (struct) â model ensemble, see buildEnsemble for fields description

  • DGr_std_min (double vector) â minimum values for standard reaction Gibbs energies

  • DGr_std_max (double vector) â maximum values for standard reaction Gibbs energies

  • vmin (double vector) â minimum values for reaction fluxes

  • vmax (double vector) â maximum values for reaction fluxes

  • xmin (double vector) â minimum values for metabolite concentrations

  • xmax (double vector) â maximu values for metabolite concentrations

  • ineqConstraints (double) â inequality constraints

  • K (double) â large value used in the MILP problem

  • RT (double) â value for the gas constant multiplied by the temperature (in Kelvin)

  • delta (double) â low value to use in the MILP problem

  • M (double) â large value to use in the MILP problem

  • tol (double) â tolerance value to use when comparing results to zero.

  • gurobiModel (struct) â MILP problem structure for gurobi

  • options (struct) â configurations for intlinprog

  • params (struct) â configurations for gurobi
